response: narrative=Thomas O'Sullivan was last seen boarding a bus near his home on March Road, Buckie. He mentioned to his sister that he planned to visit a mosque located along one of the bus routes, but never arrived. After speaking with his aunt, family members grew concerned when they were unable to reach him on his phone. O'Sullivan, who occasionally mentioned going for short hikes to stay active, was suspected to have alighted somewhere unexpected. The family speculated he might have taken a spontaneous hiking route and gotten lost, especially considering the challenging terrain near A939, Corgarff. After several days of extensive search by authorities, he was eventually found safe and returned home.

narrative=Thomas O'Sullivan, referred to as MP, was last seen at his home on March Road, Buckie. Known for his frequent visits to the senior center, his sudden absence raised concern among friends, including his colleague Maureen. The family, particularly his uncle, reached out to local authorities due to MP's high vulnerability given his disability. Initial searches at the senior center and along Seafield Circle, Buckie, where he occasionally walked, yielded no results. MP was finally traced near A939, Corgarff, a location unfamiliar to him, by police. It was believed MP wandered off in a disoriented state, confused and unable to navigate his way back. The timely intervention by the local authorities ensured his safe return home.

narrative=Thomas O'Sullivan, a 62-year-old retired psychologist with a disability, disappeared after leaving a church service. He mentioned to his friend at the church that he planned to catch a bus to visit his aunt in a nearby town. A colleague who saw him later reported that Thomas stopped by a roadhouse near a grocery store, seemingly disoriented. His last known location was at the bus station, but he never reached his aunt's home. Extensive searches were conducted by authorities. Ultimately, Thomas was found by police in a confused state at a different town, far from his intended destination, and safely returned home.

narrative=Thomas O'Sullivan, referred to as MP, was reported missing from his home on March Road, Buckie, after recently escaping from an abusive household. His sudden absence was particularly concerning given his disability and recent history. MP had mentioned to his son, Luke Lee, a desire to explore the countryside and had been seen heading towards 3 Kingsford Road, Alford, when he vanished. Search efforts focused on the area, especially around Bog Road, known for its hiking trails. Witnesses later recalled encountering MP near a roadhouse on Craigour Road, Torphins. Reports suggest he may have become disoriented while hiking alone in the unfamiliar terrain of the Torphins area. Following an extensive search, MP was safely located with the assistance of police on Inchmarlo Road, Banchory.
